text: hello this is chef john from food
whooshes calm with five-spice chicken or
lee's my version five-spice powder is
such a great ingredient but if you don't
have some I hope this recipe makes you
go out and get some I mean come on it's
got five spices that's four more spices
than your average spice so here we go
we're going to start with our marinade
which is a very simple I guess you'd
call it a wet rub so we're gonna take
half a fresh lime save the other half
we're going to use that later for the
dipping sauce all right to that I'm
going to add some freshly grated ginger
some very freshly crushed pulverized
garlic some some Bao that's chili paste
chili sauce one of my must-have
ingredients some fish sauce some soy
sauce and rice vinegar and then the star
of the show Chinese five-spice powder
all right this one's from Morton
ambassador local Northern California
spice company I love this version now
all five spice powders don't have the
same combination this one is Anna seed
fennel seed clove ginger and cinnamon so
I really like this blend it's on the
sweeter side alright so once that's
mixed together we're gonna get our
chicken ready I'm using half chickens
here nice free-range organic chicken
don't use chicken that's tortured before
you eat it it's not good on any level
we're going to do that old trick I like
where you take a knife and you make a
couple slashes in the thickest parts of
the breast and thigh that helps the
marinade get in it also helps it cook
evenly
also helps it cook a little quicker
alright we're going to smush that around
until it's evenly coated make sure you
get that wet rub into all the cracks and
crevices and those slashes you made then
we're going to transfer it to a ziplock
bag so you know on Top Chef around Food
Network where you see the chef using the
vacuum pack bag for the marinade to
force the marinade in a little quicker
you can kind of do the same thing here
by squeezing out all the air and sealing
it tight all right so you don't want any
air in there if you could help it I'm
going to marinate that for six to eight
hours you could go overnight but I think
eight hours is just about perfect and
then I'm going to grill it like I always
grill chicken I'm not going to show you
that all right I grilled chicken
numerous times on the site you can go
check those videos out but anyway what I
like to do is keep the ziplock bag I
used to marinate with and
take a brush and any of the liquids
leftover I'll just use that to kind of
glaze the skin here is it rose alright
once I got some nice marks on there I
used indirect kind of medium heat this
took about 3540 minutes and it was
perfect all right I'm going to pull that
off the grill while my chicken rests I'm
going to make a little dipping sauce
which is super easy the other half of
that lime I'd used I told you we're
going to use it a little bit of fish
sauce all right a little bit sambal rice
vinegar and mix it up I love vinegar on
grilled meat and since this seasoned
rice vinegar has salt and sugar in it it
makes it extra cool and then the
saltiness from the fish sauce and the
heat from the sambal and the tartness
from the lime and it's perfect with that
kind of sweet aromatic flavor profile
from the five-spice and the marinade
such a delicious dish incredibly easy
look at that moist juicy chicken some of
that bright sauce to just bring out the
flavors I love this little slaw I have a
couple cilantro plants in the backyard
so I picked some tops always makes for a
nice little addition all right so there
you go my totally inauthentic yet
inspired by Southeast Asian cuisine
five-spice chicken anyway I hope this
makes you go out and get some five-spice
powder a great ingredient to have around
the house you go to the site all the
ingredients are there all the specific
amounts for the marinade and the sauce
are there and as always enjoy
